casebody.data:
Bert Kinney v. The State. No. 19191. Delivered November 17, 1937.

The opinion states the case.

J. D. Todd, Jr., of Corpus Christi, for appellant. Lloyd W. Davidson, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. MORROW, Presiding Judge. —

The conviction is for unlawfully carrying a pistol; penalty assessed at a fine of $250.00.

*261The transcript is void of a notice of appeal. Such notice, given in open court and entered of record, is essential to the jurisdiction of this court. See Art. 827, Vernon’s Ann. C. C. P., Vol. 3; Pullen v. State, 125 Texas Crim. Rep., 292; Shelbourne v. State, 98 S. W. (2d) 192; Fullbright v. State, 101 S. W. (2d) 571.

The appeal is dismissed.

Appeal dismissed.
